Operators

Operators are critical in programming and as a beginner programmer it is essential that you have a full grasp of them. In this section we will be going through some of the basic/well-used operators such as Unary, Arithmetic, Rational and Logical operators. Now there is no need to worry that much as you will see some of these operator types are based on familiar mathematical concepts you have learned. But it is vitally important you know these mathematical concepts are interpreted by your IDE and what your output/result should look like before you compile. Let's begin, when dealing with multiple operators remember order of operators does play a factor.


Unary Operators

Increment symbolized as (++): increases the value by 1.

  • a++(consider a = 10)------------> Result: a = 11;

Decrement symbolized as (--): decreases the value by 1

  • a--(consider a = 10) -------------> Result: a = 9;

Arithmetic Operators

Addition symbolizes as (+): Addition of two numbers.

  • Int x = 10; Int y = 1; -----> Result: x + y = 11;

Substraction symbolized as (-): Subtraction of two numbers.

  • Int x = 10; Int y = 1; -----> Result: x - y = 9;

Multiplication symbolized as (*): Multiplication of two numbers.

  • Int x = 10; Int y = 2; -----> Result: x * y = 20;

Division symbolized as (/): Divides two numbers.

  • Int x = 12; Int y = 6; -----> Result: x / y = 2;

Modulus symbolized as (%): Divides two numbers but only returns the remainder.

  • Int x = 12; Int y = 6; -----> Result: x % y = 0;

Rational Operators

Less than symbolized as (<): Operator checks if the left-side value is smaller than right side value.

  • Int x = 40; Int y = 10; -----> Result: x < y = False

Less than or Equal to symbolized as (<=): Operator checks if the left-side value is smaller than or equal to right-side value.

  • Int x = 40; Int y = 30; -----> Result: x <= y = False

Greather than symbolized as (>): Operator check if the left-side value is greather than right-side value.

  • Int x = 40; Int y = 10; -----> Result: x > y = True

Greather than or Eqaul to symbolized as (>=): Operator checks if the left-side value is greather than or eqaul to right-side value..

  • Int x = 40; Int y = 3; -----> Result: x >= y = True

Equal to symbolized as (==): Operator checks if the value on the left-side is eqaul to value on the right-side.

  • Int x = 40; Int y = 30; -----> Result: x == y = False

Not Eqaul symbolized as (!=): Operator check if the value on the left-side is not eqaul to value on the right-side.

  • Int x = 40; Int y = 30; -----> Result: x != y = True

Logical Operators

AND symbolized as (&&): Operator checks both expressions and returns True or False.

  • Int a = 10; Int b = 20; -----> Result: (a = 10 && b = 20) True

OR symbolized as (||): Operator check at least one expression and returns True or False.

  • Int a = 10; Int b = 20; -----> Result: (a = 10 || b = 20) True

NOT symbolized as (!): Operator negates expression, if expression is True it returns False and vice-versa.

  • Int a = 10; Int b = 20; -----> Result: !(a = 10) True
